summary:
God, like... PS4 Peter Parker needs a rest.
Humiliated online constantly from J Jonah Jameson
The entire Screwball side...
body:
God, like… PS4 Peter Parker needs a rest.

  • Humiliated online constantly from J Jonah Jameson
  • The entire Screwball side mission
  • Father Figure/Mentor betrays him and nearly kills him in the process
  • The last member of his family dies to something he could’ve prevented, but he had to sacrifice her to save all of New York
  • Ex Girlfriend tricks him into thinking he’s a father, turns out she was just using him to get a hard drive
  • Only friend on the police force goes rogue and turns into a murderer
  • Blames himself for the death of a young friend’s father (a policeman he had worked with)
  • Surprise! Another kid is now burdened with the spider powers

LET HIM BE HAPPY GOOD LORD

summary: can u write boxer!tom getting jealous when his opponent boxer!harrison flirts with his girlfriend aka the reader  thanks!!!
question: can u write boxer!tom getting jealous when his opponent boxer!harrison flirts with his girlfriend aka the reader  thanks!!!
answer:
Hi, I love boxer!Tom. There’s a TINY sexual reference towards the end. And mentions of blood and beatings.

The only thing that flashes in Tom’s mind as he backs you into the locker room with his lips presses to yours is that damn blush that crept to your cheeks when Harrison called you sweetheart and winked at you. There was no denying Tom’s opponent was attractive and you had no idea that he and Tom were the worst of enemies. The way he looked, glistening in sweat, gash with butterfly bandages across his cheek, soft, long lashes fluttering as he leaned across the bungee cords to talk to you, it was all in good fun you thought. But the way Tom saw you bat your own lashes made pure envy, red hot, course through Tom’s veins. And it’s part of the reason Tom had to be peeled from a knocked out Harrison after he’d won the match.

Shoving at his shoulders, he releases you, watching you push yourself off the end of the lockers and pace away from him, dress and curled hair flowing out behind you. He admires the way you run your hand over your lips, attempting to rid yourself of the taste of him. You swallow, reaching down to rub your wrist where he grabbed you just after the match, dragging you off down the semi-lit hallway towards the locker room,

“What is the matter with you?” You ask softly, voice devoid of any emotion Tom can decipher. He swallows, wondering if you’ll continue or if the question is the first one to answer before you continue. But you breathe before speaking again,

“All that blood. The way you just… kept going after he was knocked out its just… disgusting. I’m remembering why I hated coming to see these fights.” Your eyes find his as you cross one arm across yourself in defense. The look in your eyes breaks Tom and he wants to cry in rage, frustration, sadness, jealousy. He DESPISES the way Harrison looked at you. And the way you enjoyed it. When he purses his lips, your lashes flutter,

“I’m sorry… I let my anger get the best of me.”

“Your anger? What anger? What are you mad about?” When he looks up from his hands, blood drying on the tape, your eyebrows have furrowed in worry. He looks down again, lips pursed,

“He- he flirted… with you. And you- you liked it.” He blinks the stinging behind his eyes away. He can’t cry. You’ll think he’s pathetic and you’ll leave him and that’s the last thing he needs right now when he’s just been through one of the most mentally, emotionally exhausting fights of his life. He glances at your heels when you approach him again, guiding his chin up with a finger under it. He looks all over your face, lips in a line,

“How do you know I liked it? Sure… he’s attractive but… I’m yours. I have been for two years. No one, especially him, is taking me from you.” You reach up to hold his cheeks, eyes finding the cuts in his lip. He purses his lips as best he can with your hands holding his face. He nods and sighs,

“’M sorry.”

“I’m not the one you should be apologizing to. You just knocked him unconscious and kept going.” You step again and Tom’s body screams for the affection again. But you pace away towards the showers, Tom’s mind numb. You don’t hear him as he strips, pacing towards you but passing you and heading into the showers. When he clicks the water on, you sigh, eyes closing. Turning to look at him, he avoids your eyes, letting water drench his hair and pull it over his eyes, blood mixed with water swirling around the drain. After a few moments more, he hears you sigh and the clicks of your heels again as you walk away from him. He closes his eyes, not even fighting back the tears until your hands slide across his back and over his shoulders. You lay your cheek against the edge of his shoulder blade. He swallows,

“I just… have lost enough women to that sorry son of a bitch and now here you are… after two years just fluttering your lashes and bending your knees all playful… not even for me… for him.” You can’t help but feel bad. You’d felt your cheeks flush, your heart stutter, while Harrison flirted ruthlessly before Tom. He’d opened himself up to you after admitting he was scared of love and you were proving him right. You enjoyed the flirting from Harrison after having begged Tom to give you a chance and now you were hurting him. Running your hands along his biceps, veins still protruding from the skin, you curl them around his middle, holding his body back against yours,

“I’m sorry Tom. You just- you know how I am. I wasn’t looked at much when I was a teenager, into my twenties to now. It’s nice to finally get some attention from such attractive men.” Turning on you in a second, he pins you to the cold tile wall behind you, a gasp slipping from your lips before he silences it with another passionate kiss that lasts longer than the others. He pulls back, dark eyes searching yours,

“I can give you all the attention you want. You’re mine and I can’t give you up to him, to anyone.” The pain in his eyes, the crack of his voice hurts you. When you reach up to stroke his cheek again, he blinks. Leaning in, you kiss him, holding his shoulders with your fingers in his hair. He pulls back, pressing his forehead to yours, waiting for you to speak.

“You jealous little Brit.” You say with a huff. He gives a small, broken smile,

“You have no worry in the world Thomas. I’m yours. I have been for two years and if no one has taken me from you yet, no one will. Not Harrison, not any other boxers, not any other man or woman. I’m yours.” You reassure firmly. Holding his jaw in one hand, you clench your teeth. When you give a tug of his hair like he likes, his lips turn up in the smallest bit of pain before he nods, glancing down at your lips, leaning in again, lips against yours once more. He pulls you flush against him, holding you tight in his arms until you draw back again. Holding him, the two of you let water cascade over you,

“So stop getting jealous.” He chuckles,

“That’s part of the plan though isn’t it? If I get jealous it makes you feel more wanted eh?” You giggle, nodding after a moment,

“Guess so, yeah.” He nods,

“So let me stew in jealously. Then we can bang later and it’ll go away until the next time.” You smile, kissing the corner of his mouth,

“Okay.” He nods again,

“Okay. I love you.”

“I love you too. I swear.” He purses his lips,

“I know, I know.” Watching you pick the tape from his knuckles, he swallows, wondering how he got so lucky to be here with you, to call you his. No matter what, no matter who flirts with you, it’s all part of the game that he always wins. And you’re the prize at the end.
answer_abstract: Hi, I love boxer!Tom. There’s a TINY sexual reference towards the end. And mentions of blood and beatings.

He pulls you flush against him, holding you tight in his arms until you draw back again. Holding him, the two of you let water cascade over you,

“So stop getting jealous.” He chuckles,

“That’s part of the plan though isn’t it? If I get jealous it makes you feel more wanted eh?” You giggle, nodding after a moment,

“Guess so, yeah.” He nods,

“So let me stew in jealously. Then we can bang later and it’ll go away until the next time.” You smile, kissing the corner of his mouth,

“Okay.” He nods again,

“Okay. I love you.”

“I love you too. I swear.” He purses his lips,

“I know, I know.” Watching you pick the tape from his knuckles, he swallows, wondering how he got so lucky to be here with you, to call you his. No matter what, no matter who flirts with you, it’s all part of the game that he always wins. And you’re the prize at the end.

There was no denying Tom’s opponent was attractive and you had no idea that he and Tom were the worst of enemies. The way he looked, glistening in sweat, gash with butterfly bandages across his cheek, soft, long lashes fluttering as he leaned across the bungee cords to talk to you, it was all in good fun you thought. But the way Tom saw you bat your own lashes made pure envy, red hot, course through Tom’s veins. And it’s part of the reason Tom had to be peeled from a knocked out Harrison after he’d won the match.

Shoving at his shoulders, he releases you, watching you push yourself off the end of the lockers and pace away from him, dress and curled hair flowing out behind you. He admires the way you run your hand over your lips, attempting to rid yourself of the taste of him. You swallow, reaching down to rub your wrist where he grabbed you just after the match, dragging you off down the semi-lit hallway towards the locker room,

“What is the matter with you?” You ask softly, voice devoid of any emotion Tom can decipher. He swallows, wondering if you’ll continue or if the question is the first one to answer before you continue. But you breathe before speaking again,

“All that blood. The way you just… kept going after he was knocked out its just… disgusting. I’m remembering why I hated coming to see these fights.” Your eyes find his as you cross one arm across yourself in defense. The look in your eyes breaks Tom and he wants to cry in rage, frustration, sadness, jealousy. He DESPISES the way Harrison looked at you. And the way you enjoyed it. When he purses his lips, your lashes flutter,

“I’m sorry… I let my anger get the best of me.”

“Your anger? What anger? What are you mad about?” When he looks up from his hands, blood drying on the tape, your eyebrows have furrowed in worry. He looks down again, lips pursed,

“He- he flirted… with you. And you- you liked it.” He blinks the stinging behind his eyes away. He can’t cry. You’ll think he’s pathetic and you’ll leave him and that’s the last thing he needs right now when he’s just been through one of the most mentally, emotionally exhausting fights of his life. He glances at your heels when you approach him again, guiding his chin up with a finger under it. He looks all over your face, lips in a line,

“How do you know I liked it? Sure… he’s attractive but… I’m yours. I have been for two years. No one, especially him, is taking me from you.” You reach up to hold his cheeks, eyes finding the cuts in his lip. He purses his lips as best he can with your hands holding his face. He nods and sighs,

“’M sorry.”

“I’m not the one you should be apologizing to. You just knocked him unconscious and kept going.” You step again and Tom’s body screams for the affection again. But you pace away towards the showers, Tom’s mind numb. You don’t hear him as he strips, pacing towards you but passing you and heading into the showers. Turning to look at him, he avoids your eyes, letting water drench his hair and pull it over his eyes, blood mixed with water swirling around the drain. When you reach up to stroke his cheek again, he blinks. Leaning in, you kiss him, holding his shoulders with your fingers in his hair. He pulls back, pressing his forehead to yours, waiting for you to speak.

“You jealous little Brit.” You say with a huff. He gives a small, broken smile,

“You have no worry in the world Thomas. I’m yours. I have been for two years and if no one has taken me from you yet, no one will. Not Harrison, not any other boxers, not any other man or woman. “Okay.” He nods again,

“I love you too. I swear.” He purses his lips,

summary: can i get a new spideytorch fic rec this fine wednesday evening 😌 hope ur having a good day also
question: can i get a new spideytorch fic rec this fine wednesday evening 😌 hope ur having a good day also
answer:
lmao sorry this took a while, i had finals! but sure, i can do that!! i’ll even do u one better and combine all of my past fic recs all in one post so i can have Just One and update it whenever there’s new fics in the tag! fyi these are all strictly non-mcu. as always, blanket rec on anything by @traincat!

  • work song
    • johnny and peter and the aftermath of superior spider-man and secret wars 2015. do i think you should read superior spider-man? no. should you read this? yes.
  • just married series
    • johnny and peter get married post-negative zone to fool some aliens
  • tales from the back pages
    • soulmate words au, really really cute and based around asm #1 and #3
  • the soul of love
    • johnny + cooking, post-secret wars + parker industries period
  • you light my morning sky
    • 60s au, drive-ins and milkshakes and falling in love
  • between the smoke and ruins
    • fantastic four are villains au and i love it
  • always glad you came
    • teen spideytorch + identity antics and misunderstandings
  • :D bro!!
    • college roommates, fant4stic and webb spider-man verse
  • the gay superhero alliance
    • lgbt superhero group, lots of cameos
  • in the spotlight
    • of course peter parker would be in a musical disaster about himself and johnny’s life mission is to embarrass him
  • all of these thousand miles
    • gay space roadtrip to find the fantastic four and future foundation
  • black magic, love, and other unexplainable sensations
    • fantasy au, prince johnny
  • the world, reversed
    • johnny gets kidnapped (typical), peter travels across universes to get him back
  • satellite call
    • psychic vampires! projecting all of your self hatred to the ones you love the most! fun!
  • can you tell
    • identity antics! johnny is in love with spider-man AND peter parker? shocker! (shocker is not actually in this, sorry to deceive u)
  • perfect distraction
    • high school teacher peter trying to lead a club, johnny is a distraction. i ADORE teacher peter
  • whatever a sun will always sing is you
    • post-secret wars battleworld fallout
  • with your last breath
    • last words soulmate au with the negative zone! fun!
  • you could have been mine
    • spideytorch: the one where it’s ben
  • scorched earth
    • less focus on spideytorch, but it’s there! a exploration of ben & johnny’s relationship set during marvel two-in-one (2017) #8
  • the way you see through me
    • set after spider-man/fantastic four #3! spider-man very awkwardly kissed sue, and johnny’s…jealous? no, that’s not it.
  • a melody that’s calling your name
    • fake relationship antics in high school. also, the college five foursome is real
  • til planet-rise
    • star wars au, also heist fic
  • sleeping with ghosts
    • no powers au, peter is caught up in some shady science, johnny is gay and worried
  • out of the dead lands
    • au where peter joins johnny in the negative zone
  • surrounded by wolves
    • villain peter, johnny is gay and weirdly into that, kinda
  • the boy from new york city
    • if you read one fic from this list, read this. webb spider-man and fant4stic-verse. peter puts on the mask after gwen’s death while johnny convinces the team to move back to new york
  • an unsung melody is mine
    • kid fic. johnny and peter follow in sue and reed’s steps and get baby fever
  • better in picture
    • peter & matt are dating!? no but that’s what johnny thinks. 
  • i came in from the outside, burnt out from the joyride
    • more post-secret wars 2015 sadness
  • the spider in west egg
    • kinda based on the great gatsby? but not exactly. i mean, they’re still superheroes
  • river eyes
    • spider-man noir but now featuring movie star johnny!! man we deserved fantastic four noir
  • built to fall apart (and back together)
    • au where spider-man disappears after k*ssing johnny storm. also wow! peter parker is now a millionaire? 
  • secrets kept in half light
    • spider-man noir verse. detective stuff. 

that’s it for now! i’ll keep this post updated with any new ones that come out and i like so come back to the original if it’s been a while!

title: at the end of they day (chapter five)
body:
summary:  there are two gigantic mysteries in your life and one of them includes peter parker not seeming to like you. you can him not being your friend but being in the same friend group? that should be easy, right?

a/n: stay tuned, folks! there’s gonna be much more unraveling in the near future. also idk why but i get my inspiration when its 3am. 

warnings: none, i don’t think.

masterlist / taglist / series masterlist 

Peter was at odds with himself. He knew that you liked him when he was Spider-Man, but that was because you didn’t know he was Spider-Man. He hadn’t come by your room since he left you at Stark Tower and that was three days ago. He didn’t think he could tell Ned about his predicament and decided that he’d sit in his thoughts before making a decision.

His main priority was to get his damned senses to calm down.

Why hadn’t they subsided? After all, he had found out a pretty big secret and to his knowledge, he was the only one who knew you were pretty upset about not having a father. Well, maybe MJ was an exception but that’s because she’s MJ.

Every time he was near you, he could feel his heart rate increase and his palms sweating. His breathing became hitched and all the hairs on the back of his neck stood up as if an evil villain had entered the premises.

But Peter knew that was ludicrous. In the back of his head, he accredited this feeling to having developed a very tiny crush on you.

After spending some time with you away from school where he didn’t have to worry about something happening with hundreds of innocent people around, he got to know the real you and was pleasantly surprised. He knew you were allergic to avocados, preferred walking instead of driving, and hated horror films with a passion. Your apartment’s balcony had been his save haven for when he felt like he couldn’t talk to Ned about things that had been bothering him. In the process of getting to know you for the secret he had thought you were keeping, he had really gotten to know you.

So his senses continuously going off the radar didn’t make any sense to him. He could still feel his heart beat abnormally fast when you turned around the corner and dashed away in order for him to let his body have a chance to relax. It didn’t help that you shared two classes with him and that’s when he took a stabilizing pill Tony had given him in the beginning of their partnership for moments like these where his senses were hard to control.

“Sorry,” he had heard you mumble after not having a second to process that someone had literally pushed him onto you.

Your books fell to the ground and his senses went haywire but Peter pushes those feelings down and bent down to help you pick up your books.

To say you were surprised wasn’t off the record. Peter had never spared a second glance towards you and aside from the time you got Mexican food with him and Ned, you two had never spent any time alone without him bolting after thirty seconds.

“Thanks,” you uttered, not knowing what else so say in this situation.

“Of course,” Peter replied, feeling the same. You two stood up and to your surprise, Peter didn’t walk away. “So, uh, got any plans for this weekend?”

Your eyebrow quirked. “Not much,” you said, lying about your planned meetup with Spider-Man. “Just hanging out with some friends.”

“Oh, who?”

“You wouldn’t know him,” you said. “He doesn’t go here.” Peter smiled to himself, kind of liking the idea of you taking a liking to him.

“We’ll have fun,” he said as you both exited the building for the end of the school day. “I hope you and your mystery man have fun.” You blushed at Peter teasing you and realized that this was the first time you and Peter had ever had a friendly conversation. Despite not having gotten to know him and vice versa, you felt a sense of deep familiarity and didn’t know why.

“It’s not like that,” you said sheepishly. “We’re just friends.”

“Mhm,” he said with a slight smirk. “Anyway, see you Monday?”

“Oh,” you said, trying not to wonder why he was being so casual with you. “Yeah, I’ll see you on Monday.”

Peter bade you a goodbye and you watched at his figure disappeared, wondering if you could stop questioning the events of your life.

***

“So I just watched him leave,” you told Spider-Man. You looked at his sitting figure and saw him tilt his head to the side as if he was thinking hard about what you said. “I mean, we had never really spoken and then all of a sudden he wants to get food with me and asked if he’ll see me around.”

“Weird,” he said. “Maybe he just wants to become friends.”

You shrugged. “I don’t know, Spidey. One minute he’s leaving every room I enter and the next, he’s asking wants to know about my weekend plans. Don’t you think that’s weird?”

“Not really,” he said quickly. “Maybe this Peter kid realized he was wrong to judge you before getting to know you.”

“It’s just strange,” you say, stopping in front of him. “I’m really confused and I don’t know how I feel because he’s best friends with my best friends and we aren’t friends.”

“Give him a chance,” Spider-Man pleaded with a soft voice, almost breaking. “Please.”

As you stood in front of him, Spider-Man went to grip your arms and untangled them from one another as he pulled your body closer to his. You stood in between his legs and he looked up at you for a moment before pushing himself off of your bed.

“I really like you,” you whispered to fill the silence, not knowing why it felt like the right time to tell him.

“I really like you too,” Spider-Man replied before dipping his head to press his covered lips against your cheek. He let himself linger for a while and you closed your eyes to bask in the feeling of him. He was holding your upper arms and you bit your lip, feeling a bit disappointed when he pulled away.

He looked at you and pushed your hair back from your shoulders and gently cupped your jaw with both hands and rubbed your cheeks with his covered thumbs. Spider-Man was about to lean in when Karen interrupted him.

Tony Stark requests your presence, she said.

He sighed and you chuckled, letting him know it was okay that he had to leave. After all, your balcony was always open for him.

“I’ll be back soon, I promise,” he said before kissing your cheek once more and disappearing from the window.

***

The second time you entered Stark Tower and march up to the receptionist’s desk, you’re pleasantly surprised that you were already in Tony’s system and that you had a lanyard waiting for you.

The second meeting was a bit more formal on their part because they had Phil Coulson video chat with you, Natasha, and Tony, about The Index and further steps.

“I’ve heard good things about you,” Phil said whole giving you a welcoming smile.

“I wish I could say the same,” you replied.

He chuckled. “It’s probably for the best that you didn’t know about me. I’m sure you know all about alien encounters since Thor’s appearance on Earth and it’s my job to keep everyone else at bay.”

“Do you have any information, Coulson?” Natasha asked.

“Right,” he said. “So far, we have no close DNA matches that correlate to Y/N’s DNA. We have a lot going on right now and a lot of personnel on The Index, but Fitz-Simmons have been running her DNA nonstop.”

“And do you think we’ll have a definitive answer?” Tony asked.

Phil shook his head. “Probably not, if you want to keep comparing her DNA sample to new people we find. I’ve gotta head out soon. Daisy’s been itching to fly this plane ever since May taught her how.”

“Oh really?”

Phil chuckled. “She’s a work in progress but we need another pilot. I’ll call you if anything turns up.”

The screen went blank and, quite frankly, you didn’t know what to do.

“He’s nice,” you said to fill the void. “So, uh, what’s next?”

“Honestly, kiddo, I’m not really sure,” Tony said. He had compared your DNA to his and had made a discovery, but wasn’t really sure how to go about processing it.

“Have you had a tour of this tower yet?” Natasha asked.

You shook your head. “Only the lobby and this floor.”

She smiled. “Wait right here, okay? I’m going to get you one of the best tour guides and he’ll show you around.”

“Okay,” you said, partially grateful for the gesture and partially confused by the sudden change of conversation. When Natasha left, you turned to Tony.

“I’m not finding my dad, am I?” you asked. There wasn’t much doubt in your voice, but lack of hope and confidence in the search. Even with Tony’s connections and ability to use technology to track him down, it didn’t seem like it was going anywhere.

“Don’t say that,” said Tony. “I bet he’s out there looking for you right now.”

“Right,” you said, defeated. “I’m scared to meet him, you know? He could turn out to be a drunk who’s opinionated or some cold-hearted businessman who has no time for a wife and kids.”

“He’s going to love you,” Tony said, speaking from the heart. “He’s going to cherish you with everything he’s got inside of him and he’ll want to make up for all the lost time. He loves you even if you don’t know it.”

You wiped a stray tear from your eye and Tony’s heart softened, happy that his words had touched you in a way he never imagined.

“Thank you,” you whispered. “For the words, advice, and the help. I’ve never felt so hopeful in my entire life and I’m just, I’m really happy that I’ve got some pretty great people on my side.”

As Tony was about to speak, Natasha waltzed back into the room with Steve Rogers by her side.

“Y/N, meet Steve. Or Caption America, but Steve’s just fine.”

“Jesus Christ,” you swore. “Hi, I’m Y/N.”

Steve chuckled and shook your hand. “Natasha’s been pretty busy lately and I can see why. How about I show you around the tower?”

“That sounds great!” you exclaimed, forgetting about your conversation with Tony while in the presence of Steve.

“We’ll be back in about an hour,” Steve said before you waved goodbye to the two Avengers that you left behind.

“I know you know,” Natasha said once they were it of earshot.

“Know what?” Tony replied.

“Don’t play coy with me. I know you took one of the blood samples and compared it to your own.”

“Whaaaat?” Tony asked, dragging out the ‘a.’ “Why would I do such a thing?”

“Because you have a kid and you know she’s out there,” she replied.

“How do you know that?”

“I’ve worked with you for a long time now, Tony. I’m a spy and I’m perceptive. Plus, you left the digital file open when you asked me to run F.R.I.D.A.Y’s diagnostics a few months ago and saw the header of the report.”

“And what do you think?” Tony asked anxiously.

“I think you’ve found your reason to live,” she said honestly. “To my understanding, you’ve been searching for a long time. Not only for your child, but for a reason to live. She’s it, Tony.”

“I can’t tell her I’m her father,” he said in despair. “It’ll make her feel more confused and I don’t want her to live a life where she has to worry if I’m coming home alive or not. I don’t want her to deal with the press and paparazzi when she’s trying to get to school, Natasha. I can’t put her through that.”

“It’s her decision to make. Not telling Y/N you’re her father is only going to leave her with unanswered questions for the rest of her life and she’s going to be more upset with if you don’t tell her you’re her father. She’s a smart girl and I can bet you almost anything she’ll figure it out sooner or later.”

Tony put his head in his hands. “And how do I explain why I wasn’t there for her? She’ll believe her mother over everything I say and I’m afraid that I won’t be able to tell her why I wasn’t able to find her sooner.”

“Like I said, she’s a smart girl. She’ll probably need some time to process everything but I think you owe it to her to tell your side of the story. Let her know that you’re with her, you know?” Natasha said. “You’re already important to her because you’ve been helping her out so much and going the extra mile. She understands how special this makes her and being your daughter will make her feel even more special.”

“I’ve waited seventeen years for this moment and I don’t know what to do. I can’t think of anything to say to her,” Tony begun. “Oh God, do I tell the kid?”

“Not now,” Natasha replied. “I love Peter to death but he’s a blabbermouth and considering he’s got a crush on Y/N, he’ll want to tell her everything and it should come from you.”

Tony’s head snapped up. “Peter doesn’t like Y/N like that.”

Natasha rolled her eyes. “You don’t know boys like I do. He has a thing for Y/N but I don’t think he’s made a move yet, considering she doesn’t know he’s Peter Parker.”

“What if I’ve missed Y/N’s first boyfriend? Or girlfriend? I missed her first dance, tucking her in at night, and her first day of school. How do I make up for all of that?” She sighed and patted his back.

“Look, you just need to accept that you’ve missed a lot of her firsts, but you can be there for her in the future. You can witness her graduate high school, go to college, get her first real job, and move out of the house. You’re capable of much more than you think, Tony. You’ve been preparing to be a father for seventeen years and all that preparation isn’t going to let you down.”

Despite their initial greeting, Tony couldn’t be more happy that Natalie Rushman turned out to be Natasha Romanoff. While most knew her to be heartless and emotionless, Tony knew bee heart was in the right place and she could be the person who tells you what you need to hear when you need it.

“Thanks, Romanoff,” he said.

A while later, you and Steve came back to the floor where you left from in a fit of laughter.

“You won’t believe the mouth on this kid,” he said. “She’s cracking jokes left and right. She kind of reminds me of you, Tony.”

“How funny,” Tony replied with a proud smile. “C’mon, I’ll make you one of my famous pastrami sandwiches before you leave.”

“Oh my, you don’t have to do that,” you said.

Tony waved you off. “Nah, it’s no big deal. I’ll tell you the secret ingredient to my aioli.”

Natasha smiles as she watched you leave Steve’s side and accompany Tony to the small kitchen on the floor. Steve walked to stand beside her and put his hands on his hips.

“They’re really alike, aren’t they? I can see why he likes having her around.” Natasha rolled her eyes and smiled, patting his bicep with a knowing smile.

“Sure thing, Rogers.”

“So that’s it?” you asked when he put the two sandwich in the paper bag.

“That’s it. It’s quite simple, isn’t it?”

“This is probably the one thing I’ll be making for the next two week,” you joked. “It tastes really good.”

“Well I’m glad you like it. It’s been real fun having you around, Y/N. I don’t see a lot of fresh faces around here and your interest in the Avengers and engineering makes me hopeful.”

“Oh, for what?”

Tony shrugged and grinned at you. “Nothing in particular.”

“You’re peculiar, Tony. I like it.”

He chuckled and patted on you on the shoulder as you were about to leave to the elevator, figuring a hug might be too awkward.

“See you soon, kiddo.”

“Bye Tony,” you said before quickly giving him a hug and relishing the feeling of a father figure, you thought, being in your life even if it was only temporary.

Tony grinned at you and didn’t stop when the elevator door closed. Natasha watched as Tony fist pumped the air and silently congratulated Tony on completing the one mission he had wanted to finish seventeen years ago.

***

“Do you have any information, Coulson?” Natasha asked.

“Right,” he said. “So far, we have no close DNA matches that correlate to Y/N’s DNA. We have a lot going on right now and a lot of personnel on The Index, but Fitz-Simmons have been running her DNA nonstop.”

“And do you think we’ll have a definitive answer?” Tony asked.

Phil shook his head. “Probably not, if you want to keep comparing her DNA sample to new people we find. I’ve gotta head out soon. Daisy’s been itching to fly this plane ever since May taught her how.”

“Oh really?”

Phil chuckled. “She’s a work in progress but we need another pilot. I’ll call you if anything turns up.”

The screen went blank and, quite frankly, you didn’t know what to do.

“He’s nice,” you said to fill the void. “So, uh, what’s next?”

“Honestly, kiddo, I’m not really sure,” Tony said. He had compared your DNA to his and had made a discovery, but wasn’t really sure how to go about processing it.

“Have you had a tour of this tower yet?” Natasha asked.

You shook your head. “Only the lobby and this floor.”

She smiled. “Wait right here, okay? I’m going to get you one of the best tour guides and he’ll show you around.”

“Okay,” you said, partially grateful for the gesture and partially confused by the sudden change of conversation. When Natasha left, you turned to Tony.

“I’m not finding my dad, am I?” you asked. There wasn’t much doubt in your voice, but lack of hope and confidence in the search. Even with Tony’s connections and ability to use technology to track him down, it didn’t seem like it was going anywhere.

“Don’t say that,” said Tony. “I bet he’s out there looking for you right now.”

“Right,” you said, defeated. “I’m scared to meet him, you know? He could turn out to be a drunk who’s opinionated or some cold-hearted businessman who has no time for a wife and kids.”

“He’s going to love you,” Tony said, speaking from the heart. “He’s going to cherish you with everything he’s got inside of him and he’ll want to make up for all the lost time. He loves you even if you don’t know it.”

You wiped a stray tear from your eye and Tony’s heart softened, happy that his words had touched you in a way he never imagined.

“Thank you,” you whispered. “For the words, advice, and the help. I’ve never felt so hopeful in my entire life and I’m just, I’m really happy that I’ve got some pretty great people on my side.”

As Tony was about to speak, Natasha waltzed back into the room with Steve Rogers by her side.

“Y/N, meet Steve. Or Caption America, but Steve’s just fine.”

“Jesus Christ,” you swore. “Hi, I’m Y/N.”

Steve chuckled and shook your hand. “Natasha’s been pretty busy lately and I can see why. How about I show you around the tower?”

“That sounds great!” you exclaimed, forgetting about your conversation with Tony while in the presence of Steve.

“We’ll be back in about an hour,” Steve said before you waved goodbye to the two Avengers that you left behind.

“I know you know,” Natasha said once they were it of earshot.

“Know what?” Tony replied.

“Don’t play coy with me. I know you took one of the blood samples and compared it to your own.”

“Whaaaat?” Tony asked, dragging out the ‘a.’ “Why would I do such a thing?”

“Because you have a kid and you know she’s out there,” she replied.

“How do you know that?”

“I’ve worked with you for a long time now, Tony. I’m a spy and I’m perceptive. Plus, you left the digital file open when you asked me to run F.R.I.D.A.Y’s diagnostics a few months ago and saw the header of the report.”

“And what do you think?” Tony asked anxiously.

“I think you’ve found your reason to live,” she said honestly. “To my understanding, you’ve been searching for a long time. Not only for your child, but for a reason to live. She’s it, Tony.”

“I can’t tell her I’m her father,” he said in despair. “It’ll make her feel more confused and I don’t want her to live a life where she has to worry if I’m coming home alive or not. I don’t want her to deal with the press and paparazzi when she’s trying to get to school, Natasha. I can’t put her through that.”

“It’s her decision to make. Not telling Y/N you’re her father is only going to leave her with unanswered questions for the rest of her life and she’s going to be more upset with if you don’t tell her you’re her father. She’s a smart girl and I can bet you almost anything she’ll figure it out sooner or later.”

Tony put his head in his hands. “And how do I explain why I wasn’t there for her? She’ll believe her mother over everything I say and I’m afraid that I won’t be able to tell her why I wasn’t able to find her sooner.”

“Like I said, she’s a smart girl. She’ll probably need some time to process everything but I think you owe it to her to tell your side of the story. Let her know that you’re with her, you know?” Natasha said. “You’re already important to her because you’ve been helping her out so much and going the extra mile. She understands how special this makes her and being your daughter will make her feel even more special.”

“I’ve waited seventeen years for this moment and I don’t know what to do. I can’t think of anything to say to her,” Tony begun. “Oh God, do I tell the kid?”

“Not now,” Natasha replied. “I love Peter to death but he’s a blabbermouth and considering he’s got a crush on Y/N, he’ll want to tell her everything and it should come from you.”

Tony’s head snapped up. “Peter doesn’t like Y/N like that.”

Natasha rolled her eyes. “You don’t know boys like I do. He has a thing for Y/N but I don’t think he’s made a move yet, considering she doesn’t know he’s Peter Parker.”

“What if I’ve missed Y/N’s first boyfriend? Or girlfriend? I missed her first dance, tucking her in at night, and her first day of school. How do I make up for all of that?” She sighed and patted his back.

“Look, you just need to accept that you’ve missed a lot of her firsts, but you can be there for her in the future. “Thanks, Romanoff,” he said.

“You won’t believe the mouth on this kid,” he said. “She’s cracking jokes left and right. She kind of reminds me of you, Tony.”

“How funny,” Tony replied with a proud smile. “C’mon, I’ll make you one of my famous pastrami sandwiches before you leave.”

“Oh my, you don’t have to do that,” you said.

Tony waved you off. “Nah, it’s no big deal. I’ll tell you the secret ingredient to my aioli.”

Natasha smiles as she watched you leave Steve’s side and accompany Tony to the small kitchen on the floor. Steve walked to stand beside her and put his hands on his hips.

“They’re really alike, aren’t they? I can see why he likes having her around.” Natasha rolled her eyes and smiled, patting his bicep with a knowing smile.

“Sure thing, Rogers.”

“So that’s it?” you asked when he put the two sandwich in the paper bag.

“That’s it. It’s quite simple, isn’t it?”

“This is probably the one thing I’ll be making for the next two week,” you joked. “It tastes really good.”

“Well I’m glad you like it. It’s been real fun having you around, Y/N. I don’t see a lot of fresh faces around here and your interest in the Avengers and engineering makes me hopeful.”

“See you soon, kiddo.”

“Bye Tony,” you said before quickly giving him a hug and relishing the feeling of a father figure, you thought, being in your life even if it was only temporary.

Tony grinned at you and didn’t stop when the elevator door closed. Natasha watched as Tony fist pumped the air and silently congratulated Tony on completing the one mission he had wanted to finish seventeen years ago.

“Thanks,” you uttered, not knowing what else so say in this situation.

“Of course,” Peter replied, feeling the same. You two stood up and to your surprise, Peter didn’t walk away. “So, uh, got any plans for this weekend?”

Your eyebrow quirked. “Not much,” you said, lying about your planned meetup with Spider-Man. “Just hanging out with some friends.”

“Oh, who?”

“You wouldn’t know him,” you said. “He doesn’t go here.” Peter smiled to himself, kind of liking the idea of you taking a liking to him.

“We’ll have fun,” he said as you both exited the building for the end of the school day. “I hope you and your mystery man have fun.” You blushed at Peter teasing you and realized that this was the first time you and Peter had ever had a friendly conversation. Despite not having gotten to know him and vice versa, you felt a sense of deep familiarity and didn’t know why.

“It’s not like that,” you said sheepishly. “We’re just friends.”

“Mhm,” he said with a slight smirk. “Anyway, see you Monday?”

“Oh,” you said, trying not to wonder why he was being so casual with you. “Yeah, I’ll see you on Monday.”

Peter bade you a goodbye and you watched at his figure disappeared, wondering if you could stop questioning the events of your life.

***

“So I just watched him leave,” you told Spider-Man. You looked at his sitting figure and saw him tilt his head to the side as if he was thinking hard about what you said. “I mean, we had never really spoken and then all of a sudden he wants to get food with me and asked if he’ll see me around.”

“Weird,” he said. “Maybe he just wants to become friends.”

You shrugged. “I don’t know, Spidey. One minute he’s leaving every room I enter and the next, he’s asking wants to know about my weekend plans. Don’t you think that’s weird?”

“Not really,” he said quickly. “Maybe this Peter kid realized he was wrong to judge you before getting to know you.”

“It’s just strange,” you say, stopping in front of him. “I’m really confused and I don’t know how I feel because he’s best friends with my best friends and we aren’t friends.”

“Give him a chance,” Spider-Man pleaded with a soft voice, almost breaking. “Please.”

As you stood in front of him, Spider-Man went to grip your arms and untangled them from one another as he pulled your body closer to his. You stood in between his legs and he looked up at you for a moment before pushing himself off of your bed.

“I really like you,” you whispered to fill the silence, not knowing why it felt like the right time to tell him.

“I really like you too,” Spider-Man replied before dipping his head to press his covered lips against your cheek. He let himself linger for a while and you closed your eyes to bask in the feeling of him. He was holding your upper arms and you bit your lip, feeling a bit disappointed when he pulled away.

He looked at you and pushed your hair back from your shoulders and gently cupped your jaw with both hands and rubbed your cheeks with his covered thumbs. Spider-Man was about to lean in when Karen interrupted him.

Tony Stark requests your presence, she said.

He sighed and you chuckled, letting him know it was okay that he had to leave. After all, your balcony was always open for him.

“I’ll be back soon, I promise,” he said before kissing your cheek once more and disappearing from the window.

***

The second time you entered Stark Tower and march up to the receptionist’s desk, you’re pleasantly surprised that you were already in Tony’s system and that you had a lanyard waiting for you.

The second meeting was a bit more formal on their part because they had Phil Coulson video chat with you, Natasha, and Tony, about The Index and further steps.

“I’ve heard good things about you,” Phil said whole giving you a welcoming smile.

“I wish I could say the same,” you replied.

He chuckled. “It’s probably for the best that you didn’t know about me. I’m sure you know all about alien encounters since Thor’s appearance on Earth and it’s my job to keep everyone else at bay.”

“Do you have any information, Coulson?” Natasha asked.

“Right,” he said. “So far, we have no close DNA matches that correlate to Y/N’s DNA. We have a lot going on right now and a lot of personnel on The Index, but Fitz-Simmons have been running her DNA nonstop.”

“And do you think we’ll have a definitive answer?” Tony asked.

Phil shook his head. “Probably not, if you want to keep comparing her DNA sample to new people we find. I’ve gotta head out soon. Daisy’s been itching to fly this plane ever since May taught her how.”

“Oh really?”

Phil chuckled. “She’s a work in progress but we need another pilot. I’ll call you if anything turns up.”

The screen went blank and, quite frankly, you didn’t know what to do.

“He’s nice,” you said to fill the void. “So, uh, what’s next?”

“Honestly, kiddo, I’m not really sure,” Tony said. He had compared your DNA to his and had made a discovery, but wasn’t really sure how to go about processing it.

“Have you had a tour of this tower yet?” Natasha asked.

You shook your head. “Only the lobby and this floor.”

She smiled. “Wait right here, okay? I’m going to get you one of the best tour guides and he’ll show you around.”

“Okay,” you said, partially grateful for the gesture and partially confused by the sudden change of conversation. When Natasha left, you turned to Tony.

“I’m not finding my dad, am I?” you asked. There wasn’t much doubt in your voice, but lack of hope and confidence in the search. Even with Tony’s connections and ability to use technology to track him down, it didn’t seem like it was going anywhere.

“Don’t say that,” said Tony. “I bet he’s out there looking for you right now.”

“Right,” you said, defeated. “I’m scared to meet him, you know? He could turn out to be a drunk who’s opinionated or some cold-hearted businessman who has no time for a wife and kids.”

“He’s going to love you,” Tony said, speaking from the heart. “He’s going to cherish you with everything he’s got inside of him and he’ll want to make up for all the lost time. He loves you even if you don’t know it.”

You wiped a stray tear from your eye and Tony’s heart softened, happy that his words had touched you in a way he never imagined.

“Thank you,” you whispered. “For the words, advice, and the help. I’ve never felt so hopeful in my entire life and I’m just, I’m really happy that I’ve got some pretty great people on my side.”

As Tony was about to speak, Natasha waltzed back into the room with Steve Rogers by her side.

“Y/N, meet Steve. Or Caption America, but Steve’s just fine.”

“Jesus Christ,” you swore. “Hi, I’m Y/N.”

Steve chuckled and shook your hand. “Natasha’s been pretty busy lately and I can see why. How about I show you around the tower?”

“That sounds great!” you exclaimed, forgetting about your conversation with Tony while in the presence of Steve.

“We’ll be back in about an hour,” Steve said before you waved goodbye to the two Avengers that you left behind.

“I know you know,” Natasha said once they were it of earshot.

“Know what?” Tony replied.

“Don’t play coy with me. I know you took one of the blood samples and compared it to your own.”

“Whaaaat?” Tony asked, dragging out the ‘a.’ “Why would I do such a thing?”

“Because you have a kid and you know she’s out there,” she replied.

“How do you know that?”

“I’ve worked with you for a long time now, Tony. I’m a spy and I’m perceptive. Plus, you left the digital file open when you asked me to run F.R.I.D.A.Y’s diagnostics a few months ago and saw the header of the report.”

“And what do you think?” Tony asked anxiously.

“I think you’ve found your reason to live,” she said honestly. “To my understanding, you’ve been searching for a long time. Not only for your child, but for a reason to live. She’s it, Tony.”

“I can’t tell her I’m her father,” he said in despair. “It’ll make her feel more confused and I don’t want her to live a life where she has to worry if I’m coming home alive or not. I don’t want her to deal with the press and paparazzi when she’s trying to get to school, Natasha. I can’t put her through that.”

“It’s her decision to make. Not telling Y/N you’re her father is only going to leave her with unanswered questions for the rest of her life and she’s going to be more upset with if you don’t tell her you’re her father. She’s a smart girl and I can bet you almost anything she’ll figure it out sooner or later.”

Tony put his head in his hands. “And how do I explain why I wasn’t there for her? She’ll believe her mother over everything I say and I’m afraid that I won’t be able to tell her why I wasn’t able to find her sooner.”

“Like I said, she’s a smart girl. She’ll probably need some time to process everything but I think you owe it to her to tell your side of the story. Let her know that you’re with her, you know?” Natasha said. “You’re already important to her because you’ve been helping her out so much and going the extra mile. She understands how special this makes her and being your daughter will make her feel even more special.”

“I’ve waited seventeen years for this moment and I don’t know what to do. I can’t think of anything to say to her,” Tony begun. “Oh God, do I tell the kid?”

“Not now,” Natasha replied. “I love Peter to death but he’s a blabbermouth and considering he’s got a crush on Y/N, he’ll want to tell her everything and it should come from you.”

Tony’s head snapped up. “Peter doesn’t like Y/N like that.”

Natasha rolled her eyes. “You don’t know boys like I do. He has a thing for Y/N but I don’t think he’s made a move yet, considering she doesn’t know he’s Peter Parker.”

“What if I’ve missed Y/N’s first boyfriend? Or girlfriend? I missed her first dance, tucking her in at night, and her first day of school. How do I make up for all of that?” She sighed and patted his back.

“Look, you just need to accept that you’ve missed a lot of her firsts, but you can be there for her in the future. You can witness her graduate high school, go to college, get her first real job, and move out of the house. You’re capable of much more than you think, Tony. You’ve been preparing to be a father for seventeen years and all that preparation isn’t going to let you down.”

Despite their initial greeting, Tony couldn’t be more happy that Natalie Rushman turned out to be Natasha Romanoff. While most knew her to be heartless and emotionless, Tony knew bee heart was in the right place and she could be the person who tells you what you need to hear when you need it.

“Thanks, Romanoff,” he said.

A while later, you and Steve came back to the floor where you left from in a fit of laughter.

“You won’t believe the mouth on this kid,” he said. “She’s cracking jokes left and right. She kind of reminds me of you, Tony.”

“How funny,” Tony replied with a proud smile. “C’mon, I’ll make you one of my famous pastrami sandwiches before you leave.”

“Oh my, you don’t have to do that,” you said.

Tony waved you off. “Nah, it’s no big deal. I’ll tell you the secret ingredient to my aioli.”

Natasha smiles as she watched you leave Steve’s side and accompany Tony to the small kitchen on the floor. Steve walked to stand beside her and put his hands on his hips.

“They’re really alike, aren’t they? I can see why he likes having her around.” Natasha rolled her eyes and smiled, patting his bicep with a knowing smile.

“Sure thing, Rogers.”

“So that’s it?” you asked when he put the two sandwich in the paper bag.

“That’s it. It’s quite simple, isn’t it?”

“This is probably the one thing I’ll be making for the next two week,” you joked. “It tastes really good.”

“Well I’m glad you like it. It’s been real fun having you around, Y/N. I don’t see a lot of fresh faces around here and your interest in the Avengers and engineering makes me hopeful.”

“Oh, for what?”

Tony shrugged and grinned at you. “Nothing in particular.”

“You’re peculiar, Tony. I like it.”

He chuckled and patted on you on the shoulder as you were about to leave to the elevator, figuring a hug might be too awkward.

“See you soon, kiddo.”

“Bye Tony,” you said before quickly giving him a hug and relishing the feeling of a father figure, you thought, being in your life even if it was only temporary.

Tony grinned at you and didn’t stop when the elevator door closed. Natasha watched as Tony fist pumped the air and silently congratulated Tony on completing the one mission he had wanted to finish seventeen years ago.

***

summary:  there are two gigantic mysteries in your life and one of them includes peter parker not seeming to like you. you can him not being your friend but being in the same friend group? that should be easy, right?

a/n: stay tuned, folks! there’s gonna be much more unraveling in the near future. also idk why but i get my inspiration when its 3am. 

warnings: none, i don’t think.

masterlist / taglist / series masterlist 

Peter was at odds with himself. He knew that you liked him when he was Spider-Man, but that was because you didn’t know he was Spider-Man. He hadn’t come by your room since he left you at Stark Tower and that was three days ago. He didn’t think he could tell Ned about his predicament and decided that he’d sit in his thoughts before making a decision.

His main priority was to get his damned senses to calm down.

Why hadn’t they subsided? After all, he had found out a pretty big secret and to his knowledge, he was the only one who knew you were pretty upset about not having a father. Well, maybe MJ was an exception but that’s because she’s MJ.

Every time he was near you, he could feel his heart rate increase and his palms sweating. His breathing became hitched and all the hairs on the back of his neck stood up as if an evil villain had entered the premises.

But Peter knew that was ludicrous. In the back of his head, he accredited this feeling to having developed a very tiny crush on you.
